means: （积聚造成的车辆或人的）混乱

sentence.Network_en: Stopping the car short caused a pileup on the highway.
sentence.Network_cn: 这辆汽车突然刹车使公路上的汽车排成长龙.

sentence.Network_en: Stopping the car short caused a pileup on the superhighway.
sentence.Network_cn: 这辆汽车突然刹车使高速公路上发生连环车祸.

sentence.Network_en: Eleven cars were involved in a pileup on the motorway.
sentence.Network_cn: 有十一辆车在高速公路上相撞.

entry.def: A pile-up is a road accident in which a lot of vehicles crash into each other.

list.explanation: 车祸(尤指多辆汽车首尾相撞)

example.en: 6-car, end-to-end pileup on New Jersey Turnpike
example.zh: 在新泽西州收税关卡发生的一起六辆汽车首尾相撞的车祸

example.en: My car was ruined in a pileup on the high way.
example.zh: 我的汽车在高速公路上的一次追尾事故中被撞毁了。

auth_sentence.content: "This pileup of adversities is associated with low mental health," says sociologist Ronald Kessler of Harvard Medical School.
